chargeHist.descr: Retail Theft - Failure to Pay for Service (>$500 - $5000)
Retail Theft - Failure to Pay for Service (>$500 - $5000)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph W. Schafer III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Failure to Pay for Service (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1r).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to submit DNA sample to Richland County Sheriff's Department.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

ADDRESS INFO for Joseph W. Schafer III

Defendant Joseph W. Schafer in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty J Conlon appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Counsel state that the resolution calls for amendment to misdemeanor version of the same charge for a disposition of fine and court costs.  $50 plus costs imposed.  Restitution has already been paid.  60 dtp.
email from defense counsel re. rescheduling of 06/17/15 status conference.

Defendant Joseph W. Schafer in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA states this case is being handled by special pros. Conlon.  Further status requested and set.  Status conference scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Joseph W. Schafer in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. M waives formal reading and time limits for the prelim; asks for status in April; states further investigation is needed.  Court states the charges and informs def of the possible max. penalties.  Status requested and set for April 15 at 11.  Status conference scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Joseph W. Schafer III
Current: 127 First Ave, Benton, WI 53803 United States  (Effective: 02-04-2015)
Prior: 504 East Mary Street, Darlington, WI 53530
RCSD Dispo of Warrant or Commitment

Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joseph W. Schafer appeared by video means (in custody, RCSD). Attorney Lisa A. McDougal appeared by phone means for Defendant Joseph W. Schafer.  Atty. M has received the complaint but not had opportunity to review with def.  Atty. Forehand states this was initiated by warrant as RCSD was unable to serve; Def turned himself in on warrant.  Forehand states that bond needs to be set.  Forehand states this is DA Harper's case.

Forehand asks for $1100 cash bond; notes that the def had cash on him when he reported to jail.  Def states he brought $ with him but not for bail.  

Court sets $1000 sig. bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 11:00 am.
matter should not have been on calendar today as def was not served and warrant was issued.
